NVIDIA® PhysX® SDK for NX ReadMe

Location of Binaries:

  • SDK static libraries: Lib/

Building PhysX SDK Source with Visual Studio:

  • Visual Studio Solutions and Projects are in Source/compiler/ .
  • An environment variable named NINTENDO_SDK_ROOT has to exist and point to the NintendoSDK root folder.

PhysX Visual Debugger (PVD)

  • When using sockets to connect to PVD, it is the user's responsibility to initialize the network and socket library before any connection to PVD is attempted.

Building and Running Snippets with Visual Studio:

  • It is required to build the PhysX SDK prior to building Snippets, as described above.
  • Visual Studio Solutions and Projects are in Snippets/compiler/ .
  • Compile, deploy and run from Visual Studio with F5.
  • The scenes executed in the Snippets will not render on the device but can optionally be reviewed in PVD.

Building and Running Samples with Visual Studio:

  • Samples are not supported on NX.

Known Issues:

  • Binary meta data is not provided in this package yet but can be generated using PxSerialization::dumpBinaryMetaData() from PhysXExtensions. Call dumpBinaryMetaData() while running on the platform you want to get the meta data for.

Limitations:

  • Since every PhysX scene uses a Thread Local Storage slot, the number of scenes that can be created is limited by the number of free TLS slots.

Notes:

  • General documentation on the PhysX SDK can be found under Documentation/ .
  • The KaplaDemo is only supported on Windows.
  • This package was built and tested with:
    • NintendoSDK 3.2.0_5.16
    • NintendoSDK NX Addon 3.2.0_5.16
    • Clang for NX 1.2.4
    • VSI for NX 3.0.0_18592
    • Microsoft Visual Studio 2015
